headline: Firefly raises $868 million in upsized US IPO as it sets sights on a positive liftoff
summary: (Reuters) -Northrop Grumman-backed Firefly Aerospace priced its upsized U.S. initial public offering at $45 per share on Wednesday, raising $868.3 million, and indicating strong demand for the buzzy space technology startup that put a lander on the moon.  In a nascent but rapidly growing commercial space industry, Firefly's IPO has attracted investor attention because it successfully landed its uncrewed Blue Ghost spacecraft on the moon in its first attempt in March.  U.S. President Donald Trump's focus on commercializing space technology and safeguarding the national interests in space has attracted venture capital firms and billionaires.

content.title: Firefly raises $868 million in upsized US IPO as it sets sights on a positive liftoff

In a nascent but rapidly growing commercial space industry, Firefly's IPO has attracted investor attention because it successfully landed its uncrewed Blue Ghost spacecraft on the moon in its first attempt in March.  U.S. President Donald Trump's focus on commercializing space technology and safeguarding the national interests in space has attracted venture capital firms and billionaires.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: Firefly Aerospace mission operations center in Leander

headline: Small Caliber Ammunition Market to Surpass US$ 10.75 Billion by 2033 | Astute Analytica
summary: Geopolitical tensions and robust civilian demand are fueling record consumption of centerfire ammunition, particularly the dominant 5.56mm caliber, driving continuous innovation despite raw material price volatility and persistent global supply chain disruptions.Chicago, Aug. 06, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The global small caliber ammunition market was valued at US$ 8.10 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach US$ 10.75 billion by 2033, growing at a CAGR of 3.2% during the forecast period 2025–2

content.title: Small Caliber Ammunition Market to Surpass US$ 10.75 Billion by 2033 | Astute Analytica
content.summary: Geopolitical tensions and robust civilian demand are fueling record consumption of centerfire ammunition, particularly the dominant 5.56mm caliber, driving continuous innovation despite raw material price volatility and persistent global supply chain disruptions.Chicago, Aug. 06, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The global small caliber ammunition market was valued at US$ 8.10 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach US$ 10.75 billion by 2033, growing at a CAGR of 3.2% during the forecast period 2025–2
